## Portfolio Beta with Multiple Divisions ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(303) #| eval: true #| results: asis #| echo: false #| warning: false w1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.6, sd = 0.05) w2 <- 1 - w1 b1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 1.3, sd = 0.1) b2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.7, sd = 0.1) ``` ::: An institutional investor holds two divisions of Aurora Technologies: - Division A weight = **57.52**%, beta = **1.33** - Division B weight = **42.48**%, beta = **0.74** ::: {.question-block}
✅ Portfolio Beta = wAβA + wBβB = **1.08**. This shows how different risk exposures combine in a weighted portfolio.
:::
